intro: Haplopappus acradenius subsp. bracteosus, commonly known as the bracteose horsebrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flower heads. Its botanical structure reflects its evolutionary adaptation to withstand harsh, semi-desert conditions.
